note.p: Birth: Regent's Park, London, England (15 August 1842)

Education: Schools at Kidderminster and at East Dereham, Norfolk; Bedford Modern School (ca 1856-1859); apprentice to Alfred Allchin, pharmacist (for 5 years from the age of 15); BSc (1868, London University), DSc (1871, London)

Career: Demonstrator in Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Society (1863-1872) and at the Royal College of Chemistry, London; Lecturer in Chemistry, Clifton College, Bristol (1872-1880); Professor of Chemistry and Metallurgy, Mason College (afterwards University of) Birmingham (1880); Royal College of Science (later Imperial College, London) (1894); Emeritus Professor, Imperial College, London (retired 1909); investigated the artifical production of indiarubber; 'house' at Bedford Modern School named after him (since 1998)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB (MP); DSB; Bedfordshire Times (obituary)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1928 vol 117 pp i-v, plate, signed by J C P
References: Sir Brian Pippard, FRS, 'Schoolmaster-Fellows and the campaign for science education' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 63-81, plate
N R Ingram, 'All that you can't leave behind' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 177-184
